translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Mandāravapuppha as the Foremost
“On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I scattered it over his head.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā timirapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā timirapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus did the venerable elder Timirapupphiya recite these verses.
The Elder Timirapupphiya’s Birth Story is the ninth.
